title: (NovaConnect) Llama3 NPC - AI Powered Plugin
description: Seamlessly connect to my Groq server with the Llama3 Remote AI Model Communication Plugin, featuring advanced interaction capabilities and integrated ElevenLabs API for voice output.
longDescription:
This Unreal Engine plugin leverages the Groq API to create the illusion of a highly intelligent NPC through the integration of Llama3 technology, facilitating communication via a widget interface. By incorporating a context node preset and a 'set roleplay definition' node, users can engage in conversations with this advanced NPC while defining its environmental settings within the Unreal Engine.


New Video Demonstration:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qd5uk24LImE


Using the context node (being included with Unreal's NEWEST updated download right now...):

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5PEyyq2IA3A


Update!: Our latest update includes the highly anticipated Context Node, allowing you to create even more advanced AI-driven interactions in your games!


Plugin Next Update Considerations: Including Mem0 support for ai to recall with long-term memory about topics you've chatted with your Groq Llama3 ai about.


Understanding my other Groq applications, my WordPress plugin demonstration too:

Groq Llama3 Plugin – wp-llama3.cloud


And if you'd like to test my Groq implementation with mem0 already integrated you can using my Flask implementation.

In the below remotely hosted Flask server hosted on my local machine, you can toggle on a configuration called 'MemView' which'll enable you to witness the memory branches of your ai model.

My Remote Flash Server

http://ai-server.cloud/


Note: This local hosted Flask server is just a demonstration with using (Groq combined with the mem0) implementation inside my chatui for the ai to recall facts as per your previous conversation. Meaning, even our state-less ai connected to our plugin can have this advanced long-term memory very soon too. I'm currently implementing the Mem0 framework as part of the Unreal Engine plugin in Visual Studio C++ right now. I'm quite excited to demonstrate it as a whole in a video too very soon.


Thank you for your interest in my technology. :)


Configuration for ElevenLabs:

Please be aware that you might need to update the API key and Voice ID within the ElevenLabs output node since the current details left in the node are no longer valid. My reliance on ElevenLabs has decreased, as I've shifted to XTTS. I'm considering revamping the ElevenLabs node to support XTTS as well, and this update should be available shortly. In case you possess an ElevenLabs API key, you can still utilize the existing setup, but you'll be required to input your unique voice ID since the one in the default configuration is no longer functional. I apologize for any inconvenience, but rest assured that ElevenLabs' core functionality remains intact, provided you update the necessary fields. Your understanding is appreciated, friends.


This plugin allows seamless communication with my Llama3 model hosted on Groq API server. It features a fully integrated ElevenLabs API for text translation and voice output through a TTS vocalization button embedded in the widget user interface.


Enjoy the sophisticated capabilities of this plugin, enabling efficient and enjoyable communication with the Llama3 model.


Update: I'm making progress implementing the XTTS vocal ai system within my plugin using the API server. So don't worry, free vocal ai service instead of the costly ElevenLabs service coming very soon with the free blazing fast text generation service coming very soon.


Update on the XTTS vocal feedback integration - (in place of the current ElevenLabs plugin setup):

9/23/24

The XTTS framework compatibility may be available in a couple of days. To setup your own XTTS API server. Download it here. All I know that this plugin is almost perfect using all of the super advanced free ai tools available. I find that the Llama3 model's instant output responses makes Llama3 the superior NPC game engine model with significantly high intelligence and immediate feedback. I find Groq's servers are even faster than Openai's server responses too.


The API Setup Link:

https://github.com/daswer123/xtts-api-server


Note: You've got nothing to lose with this vocal output ai system either, because it's 100% free. Except, maybe a couple of GB of harddrive space. Haha.
technicalDetails:
﻿Features: (Please include a full, comprehensive list of the features of the product)

  •  Ai chat communication
  •  TTS Vocal Response connected to ElevenLabs Api system

Code Modules: (Please include a full list of each Plugin module and their module type (Runtime, Editor etc.))

  •  OllamaPlugin.cpp
  •  OllamaPlugin.h
  •  sndfile.h
  • sndfile.hh

Number of Blueprints: 0

Number of C++ Classes: There's one single cpp file and three header files in this project. With an addition of 6 other source files for thirdparty software organized as headers in the thirdparty directory

Network Replicated: (No)

Supported Development Platforms: Windows, and Linux.

Supported Target Build Platforms: Windows, Linux.

Documentation: Link https://wayne.cool/ollama_plugin_doc/

Example Project: https://mega.nz/file/QOoEhQ6a#1zU2CODMhtPOE_EuJUpuarJs_8lkfmTwKDWu6x-4j50

Important/Additional Notes: I had fun building this plugin with GPT-4o super advanced coding Ai.
